text.0: victorious in the wood friend among men ever he claims obedience as a king.
text.1: gracious like peace blessing like mental power priest was he offeringbearer full of thought.
text.2: he bearing in his hand all manly might crouched in the cavern struck the gods with fear.
text.3: men filled with understanding find him there when they have sting prayers formed within their heart.
text.4: he like the unborn holds the broad earth up and with effective utterance fixed the sky.
text.5: o agni guard the spots which cattle love thou life of all hast gone from lair to lair.
text.6: whoso hath known him dwelling in his lair and hath approached the stream of holy law.
text.7: they who release him paying sacred ritestruly to such doth he announce great wealth.
text.8: he who grows mightily in herbs within each fruitful mother and each babe she bears.
text.9: wise life of all men in the waters homefor him have sages built as twere a seat.
